member.name: T:Meridian59.Client.BaseClient`4
member.summary: Still abstract and generic client extending RootClient class. This adds internal server-connection and message enrichment modules to the RootClient implementation, so it's able to maintain it's own connection to a server and send game messages.
member.remarks: The generics are supposed to allow you to use the abstract client class-hierarchy, but plug in your own/modified, deriving module-implementations.
member.typeparam: Type of GameTick or deriving class
Type of ResourceManager or deriving class
Type of DataController or deriving class
Type of Config or deriving class

member.name: T:Meridian59.Client.RootClient`4
member.summary: The root class of the client-class hierarchy. Just a very basic skeleton witout a real server-connection.
member.remarks: The generics are supposed to allow you to use the abstract client class-hierarchy, but plug in your own/modified, deriving module-implementations.
member.typeparam: Type of GameTick or deriving class
Type of ResourceManager or deriving class
Type of DataController or deriving class
Type of Config or deriving class

member.name: T:Meridian59.Common.StringDictionary
member.summary: Uses an underlying LockingDictionary with some specific additions to handle Meridian 59 resource strings.
member.remarks: Multilanguage dictionaries don't have a single unique primary key (resource id). Instead a string is addressed by a key tuple (id, language-code). To handle this issue we map the 2d tuple address range (id, language code) into a 1d addressrange where each language-code gets its own bracket of the target id space. Using UInt32 as target keyspace (4294967295) for the transformation and assuming all 184 languages specified in LanguageCode enum leaves 4294967295/184 = 23342213 available ids for each language.

member.summary: Counts occurences of string pattern in data.

Example: -------- Data = aaaa Pattern = aa
If SkipSubstringLengthOnMatch is true, then this function will return 2 occurences. At index 0 and 2.
If set to false it returns 3 occurences. At index 0, 1 and 2.
member.returns: Amount of occurences

member.name: T:Meridian59.Common.Constants.GeometryConstants
member.summary: Constants for geometry calculations.
member.remarks: This library is build in a scale like fine server/KOD coordinate-system/grid interpreted as floating point locally.

member.name: F:Meridian59.Common.Constants.GeometryConstants.FINENESS
member.summary: Legacy FINENESS value from drawdefs.h This is the highest resolution the legacy client and the rooms are operating in. It means 1024 client rows/cols make 1 big row/col in the servergrid.

member.name: F:Meridian59.Common.Constants.GeometryConstants.KOD_FINENESS
member.summary: Legacy KOD_FINESS value from drawdefs.h. This is the highest resolution blakserv is running at. It means 64 fine rows/cols make 1 big row/col in the servergrid. The new client/renderer also operates in this scale, but with floating point type.

member.name: F:Meridian59.Common.Constants.GeometryConstants.KODFINETOCLIENTFINE
member.summary: Multiply by this to scale from server and new client FINENESS to legacy client FINENESS

member.name: F:Meridian59.Common.Constants.GeometryConstants.CLIENTFINETOKODFINE
member.summary: Multiply by this to scale from legacy client FINENESS to server and new client FINENESS

member.name: F:Meridian59.Common.Constants.GeometryConstants.LOG_FINENESS
member.summary: Legacy LOG_FINENESS value from drawdefs.h

member.name: F:Meridian59.Common.Constants.GeometryConstants.MAXSTEPHEIGHT
member.summary: Maximum height a player can step across a wall. From legacy move.c MAX_STEP_HEIGHT.

member.name: F:Meridian59.Common.Constants.GeometryConstants.MAXANGLE
member.summary: Max. M59 angle value (in angle units). 4096 maps back to 0 like 2PI does to 0.

member.name: F:Meridian59.Common.Constants.GeometryConstants.HALFMAXANGLE
member.summary: Half of the max angle value (in angleunits)

member.name: F:Meridian59.Common.Constants.GeometryConstants.QUARTERMAXANGLE
member.summary: Quarter of the max angle (in angleunits)

member.name: F:Meridian59.Common.Constants.GeometryConstants.M59ANGLETORADQUOT
member.summary: From angle units to radian

member.name: F:Meridian59.Common.Constants.GeometryConstants.RADTOM59ANGLEQUOT
member.summary: From radian to angle units

member.name: F:Meridian59.Common.Constants.GeometryConstants.MOVEBASECOEFF
member.summary: Base coefficient for object movements. This is the distance moved in 1ms at a speed of 1. Distance in floatingpoint scale equal to the server fine-units. Multiply with dt in ms and speed (viSpeed).
member.remarks: Speed unit is defined as # big server square moves per 10000ms Calculates like this: --------------------- * 0.0001f: # bigsquares per 1ms * 64f: 64 finesquares per square

member.name: F:Meridian59.Common.Constants.GeometryConstants.PROJECTILEMOVEBASECOEFF
member.summary: Base coefficient for projectile movement speed This is the distance moved in 1ms at a speed of 1.
member.remarks: Old client interprets projectile speeds 10x faster as object movements: # big server square moves per 1000ms

member.name: F:Meridian59.Common.Constants.GeometryConstants.SECTORMOVEBASECOEFF
member.summary: Base coefficient for sector move speed. This is merged: Multiply by 16 and divide by 10000. See original code.

member.name: F:Meridian59.Common.Constants.GeometryConstants.GRAVITYACCELERATION
member.summary: This is the gravity acceleration in unit/ms². Unit is distance in client scale.

member.name: F:Meridian59.Common.Constants.GeometryConstants.CLOSEDISTANCE
member.summary: Objects must be this close for get, put, etc. In client scale.

member.name: F:Meridian59.Common.Constants.GeometryConstants.TWOPI
member.summary: Full period in radian (2*PI)

member.name: F:Meridian59.Common.Constants.GeometryConstants.QUARTERPERIOD
member.summary: Radian of quarter period

member.name: F:Meridian59.Common.Constants.GeometryConstants.HALFPERIOD
member.summary: Radian of half period

member.name: F:Meridian59.Common.Constants.GeometryConstants.PLAYERHEIGHT
member.summary: Estimated player eyes height

member.name: F:Meridian59.Common.Constants.GeometryConstants.PLAYERWIDTH
member.summary: Estimated player width in KOD (also new client float) scale.
member.remarks: See 'SetPlayerInfo()' in 'clientd3d/game.c'

member.name: F:Meridian59.Common.Constants.GeometryConstants.WALLMINDISTANCE
member.summary: Minimum distance player has to stay away from wall. This is half of the PLAYERWIDTH.

member.name: F:Meridian59.Common.Constants.GeometryConstants.WALLMINDISTANCE2
member.summary: Squared minimum distance player has to stay away from wall

member.name: F:Meridian59.Common.Constants.GeometryConstants.TARGETBEHINDRADIUS
member.summary: Max. radius for objects behind to care about them.

member.name: F:Meridian59.Common.Constants.GeometryConstants.TARGETFRONTRADIUS
member.summary: Max. radius for objects in front to care about them.

member.name: F:Meridian59.Common.Constants.GeometryConstants.MIN_NOMOVEON
member.summary: Object block radius in world scale. See MIN_NOMOVEON in 'clientd3d/move.c'
member.remarks: Calculates like this: --------------------- FINENESS: Use legacy definition as start * 0.25f: This is (FINENESS / 4) like in orig.code * 0.0625f: This lib uses server-scale in FP, orig is ROO/old client scale

member.name: F:Meridian59.Common.Constants.GeometryConstants.MIN_NOMOVEON2
member.summary: Simply MIN_NOMOVEON * MIN_NOMOVEON

member.summary: Different cases a finite line segment can intersect with an infinite line.

member.name: T:Meridian59.Data.Models.ObjectFlags
member.summary: Wrapper around 28-Bit ObjectFlags (for VANILLA), or with several extended datavalues (OpenMeridian).
member.remarks: * Blakserv is using 28-Bit (but 32-Bit are shown here, so upper 4 bits are always 0) * Bitmasks sections marked with ENUM: Must interpret all bits together as type value * Bitmasks sections marked with BOOLS: Must interpret each bit as boolean * See official manual pages 92-93 (is a bit outdated) * Definitions for C in 'include\proto.h' * Definitions for KOD in 'kod\include\blakston.khd'

member.name: T:Meridian59.Protocol.MessageEnrichment
member.summary: Reads messages from a ServerConnection and enriches their included models with their resources.
member.remarks:
This class has its own thread and is supposed to work in a pipe (asyn producer/consumer pattern) together with ServerConnection and your application's mainthread.
It basically resolves resources (loads them from harddisk) and decompresses them. All before the messages are passed to the application.
Do not read pending GameMessages in the ReceiveQueue of the ServerConnection yourself if you use this class. Instead read them from the OutputQueue property of this class.

member.name: T:Meridian59.Files.ROO.RooWallEditor
member.summary: This class implements a wall as it is saved and shown by the old roomedit.
member.remarks: They significantly differ from RooWall: (a) They can start or end at negative coordinates (b) Their Y axis/coordinate is flipped (c) Their scale is 1:64 rather than 1:1024 (d) They can get split up into two or more RooWall in BSP building

member.name: T:Meridian59.Common.Enums.ActionType

member.name: T:Meridian59.Protocol.Enums.ConnectionState
member.summary: Possible connectionstates of the ServerConnection
member.remarks: Explanation of values: ---------------------- Offline = Not connected at all Connected = Received the very first message (GetLoginMessage = AP_GET_LOGIN) after successful TCP connect Authenticated = Got a positive result to "LoginMessage", either "LoginOK" or "GetClient" Waiting = Received a "WaitMessage" (BP_WAIT), game is frozen during server save Online = Received a "GameStateMessage" (AP_GAME), this is also the transition from LoginMode to GameMode in the protocol messages Playing = Set when tracked an sent/outgoing "BP_USE_CHARACTER" message

member.name: P:Meridian59.Drawing2D.RenderInfo.Quality
member.summary: Quality of the image. Using different quality values does not necessarily affect image quality. More likely this specifies an upper maximum of quality. By default this is 1.0f which refers to a maximum of 1024x1024 imagesize. Set this to 0.5f for maximum of 512x512, to 0.25f for 256x256 and 2.0f for 2048x2048. Many composed objects however can be rendered with much less size without downscaling parts and therefore will be created at these lower sizes, no matter how you set this.
